refnamediv.refpurpose: Register a user with the XML Storage System

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This method allows users to register within XML Storage System. The actions performed on the server are:

simplelist.member: make a new Web account named <email> with the password specified.
make a home-folder in WebDAV repository as /DAV/<email>.

refsect2.title: email
refsect2.para: For user identification, this should be a valid email account.

refsect2.title: name
refsect2.para: A human readable name for the user account.

refsect2.title: password
refsect2.para: The password for authentication. Note that this is the only call that sends the password in clear-text. All other functions send the password as a MD5 hash.

refsect2.title: clientPort
refsect2.para: Currently ignored and reserved for future use.

refsect2.title: userAgent
refsect2.para: Currently ignored and reserved for future use.

refsect2.title: serialNumber
refsect2.para: Currently ignored and reserved for future use.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: This method returns a structure as follows:
refsect1.programlisting: 'usernum' string account id 'flError' boolean 0 success, 1 fault 'message' string fault message (can be used to handle error cases)

example.title: Registering a new user
example.screen:
SQL> SOAP_CLIENT (url=>'http://example.com/xmlStorageSystem', operation=>'registerUser', parameters=>vector ('email','user@example.domain', 'name', 'Somebody Name', 'password', 'xxx', 'clientPort', 0, 'userAgent', '' , 'serialNumber', ''));
- SOAP response <registerUserResponse> <Result> <usernum>user@example.domain</usernum> <flError>0</flError> <message>Welcome, Somebody Name</message> </Result> </registerUserResponse>
